messages.content:
Here's some context from web searches:

Description: In most states, for a will to be legal, the following must be true: The testator must be at least 18 years old. Most states require the testator (writer of the will) to be an adult. However, some states make exceptions for emancipated minors, married minors, and minors in the military.
URL: https://www.forbes.com/advisor/legal/estate-law/last-will-and-testament/

Description: A last will and testament is a legal document that states how a person wishes to distribute their assets upon their death. Although requirements vary by state, usually your will needs to be in writing, signed by the testator, and witnessed by at least two other people.
URL: https://www.ncoa.org/adviser/estate-planning/last-will-and-testament/

Description: Wills can be simple to create but have requirements that must be addressed in order for them to be considered valid. Please check your state laws regarding a last will and testament to be sure you take the right steps when creating yours.
URL: https://www.investopedia.com/terms/l/last-will-and-testament.asp

Description: In 49 States, a will can be signed by two disinterested witnesses (Louisiana requires a notary public). However, it is recommended a will be notarized to have a 3rd party acknowledge that the testator was competent when signing the document. Self-Proving Affidavit – Use if the testator elects ...
URL: https://eforms.com/wills/

Description: Your last will and testament is not valid until the signing and witnessing requirements have been met. You must be mentally competent when you sign the Will, and in most states, you must meet a minimum age requirement of at least 18 years old. Your signature to your last will must be witnessed ...
URL: https://www.rocketlawyer.com/family-and-personal/estate-planning/make-a-will/document/last-will-and-testament

Description: Customize, print, and download your free Last Will and Testament in minutes.
URL: https://www.lawdepot.com/contracts/last-will-and-testament-usa/?loc=US

Description: Everyone should consider having a last will and testament as part of their estate plan to take care of their property and remaining assets when they pass away. According to the American Bar Association, you don’t have to use a lawyer to write your will. A will is legally valid if it meets your state’s requirements ...
URL: https://legaltemplates.net/form/last-will-testament/

Description: A last will and testament allows you to decide how you want your property to be distributed among family, friends or charities. LegalZoom can help you start your last will and deliver it to your door.
URL: https://www.legalzoom.com/personal/estate-planning/last-will-and-testament-overview.html

Description: Overview of a Florida last will and testament, including discussion of the differences between a will and a trust. Explanation of key parts of a will.
URL: https://www.alperlaw.com/estate-planning/florida-last-will-and-testament/

Description: FreeWill lets you make your last will and testament quick, easy, and completely free. It is a simple online legal will maker that helps you compile will forms to print and sign, or to take as a basic will template to an estate planning lawyer. FreeWill is built alongside will making experts.
URL: https://www.freewill.com/learn/california-last-will-and-testament

Please use this information to inform your response.

User query: make will for joe he has no assets and creamted
